main_definition: Sense refers to the ability to perceive or understand something, often through sensory experiences such as touch, taste, smell, sight, and hearing.

meanings_and_examples.example: He lost his sense of smell after the accident.
Having a good sense of humor means you easily understand and appreciate jokes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Sensitivity to something, such as danger or change
meanings_and_examples.example: She has a strong sense of responsibility towards her family.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Intuitive perception or insight into situations
meanings_and_examples.example: He had a keen sense that something was wrong at the party.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Sense of taste, one of the five senses that enables us to perceive flavors
meanings_and_examples.example: The chef's dish lacked any real sense of saltiness or spice.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Sense of hearing, one of the five senses that allows humans to perceive sound
meanings_and_examples.example: His hearing was impaited due to years in a noisy work environment.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Sense of touch, one of the five senses that enables us to feel physical contact with objects
meanings_and_examples.example: She used her sense of touch to guide herself through the dark room.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Sense of sight, one of the five senses that allows humans to perceive visual information and images
meanings_and_examples.example: The vibrant colors he saw were a testament to his keen sense of sight.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A phrase used metaphorically or idiomatically, often referring to an innate understanding or awareness about something
meanings_and_examples.example: She has a good sense for fashion and always dresses impeccably.
